revised_title: Fossil Pteridospermous Plants from Mesozoic Rocks of South Africa
tldr: This article discusses the study of pteridospermous plants from Mesozoic rocks in South Africa. The author examines the cuticular structure and morphology of these plants, which were once thought to be ferns but are now known to be seed-bearing plants. The research contributes to the understanding of the nature and affinities of Mesozoic floras and the relationship between these plants and modern gymnosperms.
